Hey Colin,

CPPNs, being an indirect encoding, allow for small changes in t=
he genotype to have profound effects on the resulting substrate.  While thi=
s is what makes indirect encodings so powerful, the drawback is that it is =
hard to make a population drift in a particular gradient along the fitness =
landscape. In practice, I've noticed that adding recurrence magnifies this =
problem without providing much benefit in terms of overall fitness.

Jason =
G.
